{"step_by_step_thinking": "The labial frenum is a fold of tissue that connects the upper lip to the gum. If a diastema (gap) between the front teeth is caused by a thick labial frenum, treatment usually involves a frenectomy, which is the surgical removal or reduction of the frenum. The purpose of the frenectomy is to release the tension caused by the frenum and allow the teeth to come together. Therefore, the treatment of diastema because of a thick labial frenum is done after frenectomy.", "answer_choice": "A"}
